        newVStyle
      • newVStyle(body: untyped): VStyle

Example:

import src/actim/vstyles

let somePadding = 20.px
let someOtherPadding = (somePadding * 2) + 3.px
let someColor = "#44ffaa"

let someStyleId = newVStyle:
  "height": 10 * somePadding
  "width": 40.pct
  "padding": fmt"{somePadding} {someOtherPadding}"
  "font-weight": "bold"
  ++ ":hover":
    "background-color": someColor

let someBaseStyle = newVStyle:
  "width": 50.pct

let someOtherStyleId = extendVStyle someBaseStyle:
  "height": 50.pct

Types

EmptyStyleSelectorError = ref object of CatchableError
Size = ref object
  case kind: SizeKind
  of calc:
      op: Op
      lhs, rhs: Size

  else:
      case isFloat: bool
      of true:
        fval: float
      of false:
        ival: int
    
  
VStyle = OrderedTable[string, VAttrs]

func em(v: int | float): Size
proc merge(a, b: VStyle): VStyle {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Merge 2 style defenitions. If an attribute is defined in a and b, the value of b is used. 
func pathSelector(baseId: string; pos: openArray[Natural]): string {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
func pct(v: int | float): Size

    ...raises: [EmptyStyleSelectorError], tags: [].}

func vmin(v: int | float): Size
func vw(v: int | float): Size

Macros

macro extendVStyle(extends: VStyle; body: untyped): VStyle
Extend a vstyle. uses the same syntax as newVStyle

Templates

template `*`(f: int | float; s: Size): Size
template `-`(s: Size): Size
template `/`(f: int | float; s: Size): Size
template newVStyle(body: untyped): VStyle
Create a vstyle.

Example:

let style = newVStyle:
  "padding": fmt"{5.px} {5.px * 2}"
  "background-color": "#44ffaa"
  "font-weight": "bold"
